fact: Water covers about 71% of the Earth's surface.
97% of the Earth's water is saltwater, found in oceans and seas.
Only about 3% of the Earth's water is freshwater, and of that, over two-thirds is frozen in glaciers and polar ice caps.
The world's largest freshwater lake by volume is Lake Baikal in Russia, which contains about 20% of the Earth's unfrozen freshwater.
Water is the only substance that exists in all three states of matter (solid, liquid, and gas) at temperatures commonly found on Earth.
Water is a universal solvent, meaning it can dissolve more substances than any other liquid.
Water is the most commonly used substance to generate electricity through hydroelectric power plants.
Water regulates the Earth's temperature and helps to distribute heat around the planet.
The human body is about 60% water.
Water helps to transport nutrients and oxygen to cells in the body.
Water can help to reduce the risk of kidney stones and urinary tract infections.
Water can help to reduce the risk of dehydration, which can cause fatigue, headaches, and other health problems.
Water can help to improve skin health and reduce the appearance of wrinkles and fine lines.
Water can help to improve digestion and prevent constipation.
